00:00:02:170000.Speaker: Raj
00:00:02:170000.Dialogue: Hey, want to spend some time playing the new Star Wars game this weekend?

00:00:06:010000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:06:010000.Dialogue: Oh, I don't know. I kind of promised myself I'd get off the computer, be more physically active. Get some exercise...

00:00:11:170000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:11:170000.Dialogue: You're about to walk up three flights of stairs.

00:00:19:090000.Speaker: Raj
00:00:19:090000.Dialogue: KOOTHRAPPALI: You know what would be great? Let's do it like the old days.

00:00:23:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:23:060000.Dialogue: You mean, are you talking gaming marathon?

00:00:25:050000.Speaker: Raj
00:00:25:050000.Dialogue: Yeah. Start Saturday morning, go 48 hours, sleeping bags, junk food...

00:00:30:080000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:30:080000.Dialogue: Turn off our phones so our moms can't call.

00:00:35:080000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:35:080000.Dialogue: It would be like our World Of Warcraft a few years ago when the neighbors called the cops on us.

00:00:40:200000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:40:200000.Dialogue: They called the cops because of the smell. They thought we were dead.

00:00:46:210000.Speaker: Raj
00:00:46:210000.Dialogue: We were badass back in the day.

00:00:58:120000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:58:120000.Dialogue: Hey, Sheldon, clear your weekend. Starting Saturday morning, Star Wars marathon

00:01:03:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:03:140000.Dialogue: Movies or video games? No, board game? Or trading card games? Or Lego's? Or dress up? Or comic books?! Or dramatic readings of novelizations?! Yes to all!

00:01:14:140000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:14:140000.Dialogue: We are going to play the online game.

00:01:21:150000.Speaker: Amy
00:01:21:150000.Dialogue: Gentlemen, as much as I'm sure Sheldon would enjoy playing intergalactic make-believe, he and I have other plans. We are attending my Aunt Flora's 93rd birthday party.

00:01:30:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:30:090000.Dialogue: Just tell her I can't come.

00:01:32:170000.Speaker: Amy
00:01:32:170000.Dialogue: She'll be disappointed if we don't show up.

00:01:35:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:35:020000.Dialogue: She's 93. She won't be disappointed for very long.

00:01:40:060000.Speaker: Amy
00:01:40:060000.Dialogue: No, hang on. I followed all the protocols set forth by you in the relationship agreement. I made a written record request 72 hours in advance.

00:01:49:110000.Speaker: Amy
00:01:49:110000.Dialogue: I checked the tire pressure on the car. I even contacted the Centers For Disease Control to find out what shots they recommend for travel to Orange County.

00:02:00:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:00:200000.Dialogue: Amy, the relationship agreement was not designed for either one of us to get our way.

00:02:05:200000.Speaker: Amy
00:02:05:200000.Dialogue: You use it to get your way.

00:02:07:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:07:180000.Dialogue: I use it to get the right way.

00:02:11:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:11:080000.Dialogue: The fact that the right way is also my way is a happy coincidence.

00:02:16:150000.Speaker: Amy
00:02:16:150000.Dialogue: You gave me your word. You're coming with me.

00:02:20:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:20:100000.Dialogue: Yeah, well, who wants to spend the whole weekend, running around a bunch of pretend planets battling made up monsters. That's for babies.

00:02:30:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:30:180000.Dialogue: Yeah, please, Amy! It's got lightsabers!

00:03:03:210000.Speaker: Stuart
00:03:03:210000.Dialogue: Hey Sheldon. Help you with anything?

00:03:06:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:06:230000.Dialogue: Yes. I'm attending a party this weekend, for a 93-year-old woman.

00:03:15:180000.Speaker: Stuart
00:03:15:180000.Dialogue: Uh, I don't know. Could put a tennis ball on the end of Excalibur. Make a pretty badass cane.

00:03:30:140000.Speaker: Stuart
00:03:30:140000.Dialogue: Hmm... Oh, have this collectors edition Batman utility belt. Maybe she can use it as a wearable pill caddy.

00:03:40:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:40:230000.Dialogue: Well, she'd just look silly wearing that without the rest of the costume.

00:03:47:170000.Speaker: Stuart
00:03:47:170000.Dialogue: I'm sorry Sheldon, that's it. That's all I got.

00:03:50:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:50:030000.Dialogue: Oh, it's not your fault. I've been to the model train store. I've been to Radio Shack. This woman is impossible to shop for.

00:03:57:030000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:57:030000.Dialogue: I'd make fun of Sheldon for having girl problems if I wasn't in shock that Sheldon has girl problems.

00:04:03:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:03:070000.Dialogue: No, Leonard, go ahead and mock. Like my daddy always said, Shelly, women aren't anything but flippin' pains in the bottom.

00:04:14:050000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:14:050000.Dialogue: That's what your father used to say?

00:04:15:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:15:190000.Dialogue: Well, I took out the bad words and the yeehaw, but you get the gist.

00:04:21:210000.Speaker: Howard
00:04:21:210000.Dialogue: Look, if you don't want to go to the party, just don't go. You're a grown man. Act like one. Tell Amy you want to spend the weekend having a sleepover and playing video games with your friends.

00:04:32:210000.Speaker: Howard
00:04:32:210000.Dialogue: Maybe she'll dig it. Women like a firm hand on the tiller.

00:04:37:050000.Speaker: Raj
00:04:37:050000.Dialogue: I can never find the tiller.

00:04:41:220000.Speaker: Raj
00:04:41:220000.Dialogue: I got a book; it didn't help.

00:04:45:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:45:100000.Dialogue: Yeah, I always thought if I were ever enslaved, it would be by an advanced species from another planet, not some hotsy-totsy from Glendale.

00:04:55:040000.Speaker: Howard
00:04:55:040000.Dialogue: Now, I downloaded an app that might be helpful in this situation.

00:05:04:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:04:230000.Dialogue: You're right. I'm smart as a whip. I should be able to figure this out.

00:05:13:080000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:13:080000.Dialogue: Hey, listen, I kind of made plans with the guys this weekend, but then I wondered, because we're in this relationship-beta-test, if I should have asked you first. Then I thought if I did check with you first, then you'd think that I was taking things to seriously. And then-en I got a nosebleed.

00:05:30:000000.Speaker: Penny
00:05:30:000000.Dialogue: You don't have to check with me. Do whatever you want.

00:05:34:130000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:34:130000.Dialogue: Oh. I guess I was hoping for a different reaction, but okay.

00:05:39:030000.Speaker: Penny
00:05:39:030000.Dialogue: Really, what were you hoping for?

00:05:41:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:41:040000.Dialogue: I don't know, maybe that you'd be a little upset, and then you'd realize that I'm a stallion that has to run free.

00:05:52:190000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:52:190000.Dialogue: And that would turn you on a little.

00:05:55:060000.Speaker: Penny
00:05:55:060000.Dialogue: Okay, I'm an actress. Ask me again.

00:05:59:010000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:59:010000.Dialogue: Do you mind if I spend the weekend playing video games with the guys?

00:06:02:220000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:02:220000.Dialogue: Wha... the entire weekend? You mean I wouldn't see you at all? But I j... No, no... I knew what I was getting into.

00:06:11:010000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:11:010000.Dialogue: You can't put a saddle on Leonard Hofstadter.

00:06:16:060000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:16:060000.Dialogue: Oh, my, is it getting hot in here? Ay,papi.

00:06:33:040000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:33:040000.Dialogue: Choo got a problem with that, papi?

00:06:43:040000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:43:040000.Dialogue: Sorry, Stallion. Your weird friend Giraffe is here.

00:06:48:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:48:200000.Dialogue: Hello, Penny! I just stopped by to bring you this gift.

00:06:54:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:54:180000.Dialogue: Now that you're in my debt...

00:06:58:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:58:060000.Dialogue: ...please manipulate Amy into releasing me from my commitment to attend her aunt's tedious birthday party.

00:07:05:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:05:180000.Dialogue: All right. I thought the candy might not be enough so let me up the ante.  These are Cooper Coupons.

00:07:12:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:12:200000.Dialogue: These are for various things I can do for you. Um, oh, this one is for one free grammar check.

00:07:19:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:19:150000.Dialogue: Uh... You could use it for emails, letters, tattoos, what have you. Um... Oh, this is fun one! This is an afternoon with me at the California Science Center, where I point out their mistakes.

00:07:34:030000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:34:030000.Dialogue: Keep an eye on those expiration dates, I've been burned more than once.

00:07:39:020000.Speaker: Penny
00:07:39:020000.Dialogue: All right, sweetie, I'm not going to get involved in your relationship.

00:07:42:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:42:160000.Dialogue: Oh, come on. It's just a simple favor. Now, when's the last time I asked you to do something for me?

00:07:47:040000.Speaker: Penny
00:07:47:040000.Dialogue: Yesterday. You made me look in your ear to see if there was a ladybug in it.

00:07:51:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:51:090000.Dialogue: When is the last time I asked you to do something that wasn't a medical emergency?

00:07:55:160000.Speaker: Penny
00:07:55:160000.Dialogue: Yesterday. You made me look in your ear to see if there was a ladybug in it.

00:08:00:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:00:200000.Dialogue: All right, then, I have no choice but to go on to plan B.

00:08:04:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:04:200000.Dialogue: I'm going to run around outside with a wet head and try to catch a cold.

00:08:15:020000.Speaker: Amy
00:08:15:020000.Dialogue: I think you're really going to enjoy yourself today. Not only do you get to meet my relatives, but since you aunt's nursing home is catering the party, all of the food is incredibly soft. It's like a vacation for your teeth.

00:08:28:160000.Speaker: Amy
00:08:28:160000.Dialogue: You sure you're okay with this?

00:08:30:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:30:080000.Dialogue: Yes. I decided to find a way that I could have this experience and enjoy it.

00:08:36:120000.Speaker: Amy
00:08:36:120000.Dialogue: Thank you. That means a lot to me.

00:08:39:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:39:080000.Dialogue: Oh, don't thank me. Thank wireless technology. I realized, I can go to your aunt's awful party and still spend the whole day gaming with my friends.

00:08:49:150000.Speaker: Amy
00:08:49:150000.Dialogue: Sheldon, my relatives are going to want to talk to you, and you're going to be sitting there playing a game? Isn't that a little rude?

00:08:57:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:57:020000.Dialogue: Oh, I got that covered. Headset. I won't hear a word the old geezers are saying.

00:09:06:020000.Speaker: Amy
00:09:06:020000.Dialogue: You know, if playing that game is more important to you than honoring your commitment to me, and you don't mind me showing up at a party all by myself after I've already told everybody I'll be bringing somebody, then, fine. Go home and play your game.

00:09:23:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:23:020000.Dialogue: Ooh, listen, I wouldn't mind a piece of birthday cake, provided the old gal's candle blow is clean and dry.

00:09:42:230000.Speaker: Raj
00:09:42:230000.Dialogue: Here you go. I've got everything we'll need for the big game: lowfat turkey jerky...

00:09:55:020000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:55:020000.Dialogue: You pick up a Y chromosome while you were there? You might be short one.

00:09:59:110000.Speaker: Raj
00:09:59:110000.Dialogue: Hey, I plan on leveling up in the game, not my swimsuit size, thank you very much.

00:10:05:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:05:050000.Dialogue: Gentlemen, the game offers us a choice, between playing for the Republic and the light side, or the Sith Empire and the dark side.

00:10:13:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:13:100000.Dialogue: Well, we're always the good guys. In D&D, we're lawful good, in City Of Heroes, we're the heroes, and Grand Theft Auto, we pay the prostitutes promptly, and never hit them with a bat.

00:10:29:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:29:090000.Dialogue: You said they were raising money for stem cell research.

00:10:34:090000.Speaker: Howard
00:10:34:090000.Dialogue: Hey, guys, I got a surprise.

00:10:37:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:37:100000.Dialogue: Uh, if it's yogurt that helps ladies poop, I think Raj beat you to it.

00:10:41:190000.Speaker: Howard
00:10:41:190000.Dialogue: No. Bernadette's going to be playing with us. So, that's pretty cool, huh? Right? Sure it is, yeah.

00:10:48:120000.Speaker: Raj
00:10:48:120000.Dialogue: What, you invited your girlfriend?! This is supposed to be our weekend!

00:10:54:000000.Speaker: Howard
00:10:54:000000.Dialogue: I had no choice. Last night, she said, Why don't we go out for brunch tomorrow and then maybe the Arboretum. And I said, Well, no, I promised the guys I was going to play a video game with them all weekend. And she said, That sounds like fun. Can I come, too? And then I didn't answer for a second, and then she said, Well, do you not want me to come? And then I bought her a new laptop and the game, and she's parking the car right now.

00:11:12:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:12:180000.Dialogue: Is the whip sound app contextually appropriate here?

00:11:16:150000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:16:150000.Dialogue: Uh, it is, but I think you might've waited too long for it to be funny.

00:11:25:160000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:25:160000.Dialogue: I was wrong; it's still funny.

00:11:41:160000.Speaker: Penny
00:11:41:160000.Dialogue: Well, I know he didn't cheat on you, so what happened?

00:11:45:170000.Speaker: Amy
00:11:45:170000.Dialogue: I had to go to my aunt's party all by myself, and everybody was like, Where's this boyfriend you're always talking about? Is he real, or did you make him up like Armen, the miniature horse breeder?

00:11:57:010000.Speaker: Penny
00:11:57:010000.Dialogue: Who's Armen the miniature horse breeder?

00:11:59:190000.Speaker: Amy
00:11:59:190000.Dialogue: The pretend boyfriend I invented to get my family off my back. It unraveled quickly when I couldn't answer the question How'd you two meet?

00:12:07:180000.Speaker: Penny
00:12:07:180000.Dialogue: I would have thought at a miniature horse show.

00:12:17:070000.Speaker: Amy
00:12:17:070000.Dialogue: I just wanted to show Sheldon off to my family.

00:12:20:050000.Speaker: Penny
00:12:20:050000.Dialogue: Sure, I get that. I mean, he's your first boyfriend and all.

00:12:23:180000.Speaker: Amy
00:12:23:180000.Dialogue: Not just my first boyfriend, he's the best boyfriend. I mean, think about it. I'm dating Sheldon Cooper.

00:12:36:040000.Speaker: Amy
00:12:36:040000.Dialogue: He's handsome, he's lanky, he's brilliant, and his skin has that pale, waxy quality.

00:12:43:090000.Speaker: Penny
00:12:43:090000.Dialogue: Well, sickly is the new sexy.

00:12:51:060000.Speaker: Penny
00:12:51:060000.Dialogue: You know, Amy, sometimes when you're in a relationship with someone you really care about, the sucky part is, it leaves you open to getting hurt.

00:12:58:220000.Speaker: Amy
00:12:58:220000.Dialogue: Do you ever worry about Leonard doing that to you?

00:13:06:190000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:13:06:190000.Dialogue: Get that guy! Get that guy! Pew! Pew! Pew! Pew!

00:13:12:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:12:040000.Dialogue: Dr. Rostenkowski, it may interest you to know that saying pew, pew, pew isn't as effective as pressing your blaster key. In the same way that saying whee! doesn't make the land speeder go.

00:13:29:150000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:29:150000.Dialogue: Raj, Imperial Troopers on your tail.

00:13:31:060000.Speaker: Raj
00:13:31:060000.Dialogue: Got him. When Gandhi advocated his philosophy of non-violence, I bet he didn't know how much fun it was killing stuff.

00:13:39:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:39:220000.Dialogue: All right, I think we got them all. Let's divide up the loot.

00:13:44:030000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:13:44:030000.Dialogue: BERNADETTE: Ooh, look at this pretty purple robe I just got. You should put on yours and then we'll match.

00:13:49:030000.Speaker: Howard
00:13:49:030000.Dialogue: But I worked hard to get this armor.

00:13:52:000000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:13:52:000000.Dialogue: Sorry, I just thought it'd be nice if people knew we were a couple.

00:14:11:190000.Speaker: Amy
00:14:11:190000.Dialogue: I don't think I want to play a game.

00:14:13:150000.Speaker: Penny
00:14:13:150000.Dialogue: Oh, come on! They're playing one across the hall-- we should, too. Okay, we are gonna take turns bouncing a quarter off the table, and if it goes into this cup, the other person has to drink. Then you get to go again...

00:14:31:010000.Speaker: Penny
00:14:31:010000.Dialogue: Wow. Yeah, b-beginner's luck. So, now I will drink this entire cup of beer, and you will go again...

00:14:41:120000.Speaker: Penny
00:14:41:120000.Dialogue: Uh... All right. So, yeah, okay, now I'm gonna drink this entire cup and then I'm going to drink another one. Okay, seriously, stop. What the hell?

00:14:51:160000.Speaker: Amy
00:14:51:160000.Dialogue: Spent a lot of my childhood throwing coins into wishing wells hoping for friends. At a certain point, you start doing trick shots just to keep things interesting.

00:14:59:180000.Speaker: Penny
00:14:59:180000.Dialogue: Whoa, give me a second to catch up here. Hold on.

00:15:04:110000.Speaker: Amy
00:15:04:110000.Dialogue: That'd be my boyfriend happier playing his dopey Star Trek game with his friends than hanging out with me.

00:15:12:170000.Speaker: Penny
00:15:12:170000.Dialogue: Star Wars. They get all cranky when you mix the two up.

00:15:21:210000.Speaker: Amy
00:15:21:210000.Dialogue: How do I get him to treat me better?

00:15:24:140000.Speaker: Penny
00:15:24:140000.Dialogue: All right. Let me give you a little girlfriend 101. Usually the first move out of the gate is you withhold sex, but that will work better after Sheldon hits puberty. So, I'd say... give him the silent treatment.

00:15:41:090000.Speaker: Amy
00:15:41:090000.Dialogue: Our record for sitting in a room together and not speaking to each other is six-and-a half hours. He said it was a magical evening.

00:15:49:040000.Speaker: Penny
00:15:49:040000.Dialogue: All right, then we're gonna have to go with an oldie but goodie; making a scene.

00:15:53:130000.Speaker: Amy
00:15:53:130000.Dialogue: I don't think I'd be good at that.

00:15:55:200000.Speaker: Penny
00:15:55:200000.Dialogue: That's why you're lucky to have me. Back in Omaha, there are two different restaurants I'm not allowed into. Both Chili's.

00:16:04:160000.Speaker: Raj
00:16:04:160000.Dialogue: Bernadette, remember, your character's the healer in our group. You're in charge of healing all of us, not just Howard.

00:16:10:180000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:16:10:180000.Dialogue: I can't help it. My Howie Wowie has an owie.

00:16:16:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:16:060000.Dialogue: That is the most sickeningly sweet thing I have ever experienced. And I am sipping Kool-Aid through a Red Vine.

00:16:26:080000.Speaker: Amy
00:16:26:080000.Dialogue: Sheldon Cooper, I've got a bone to pick with you,

00:16:29:070000.Speaker: Amy
00:16:29:070000.Dialogue: and I'm about to do it in front of all your friends.

00:16:31:230000.Speaker: Penny
00:16:31:230000.Dialogue: Yeah, you pick that bone. You pick that bone clean!

00:16:35:200000.Speaker: Amy
00:16:35:200000.Dialogue: I'm gonna publicly shame you, and then sit back as societal pressure compels you to modify your behavior.

00:16:44:050000.Speaker: Amy
00:16:44:050000.Dialogue: And if you don't start treating me better, I'm leaving you

00:16:47:010000.Speaker: amy
00:16:47:010000.Dialogue: for a miniature horse breeder named Armen.

00:16:56:170000.Speaker: Penny
00:16:56:170000.Dialogue: Look, Sheldon, she wanted to show you off to her family, and you stood her up, okay? Look at this adorable, smushy face. Smush, smush, smush.

00:17:15:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:15:130000.Dialogue: I think I understand. You're the one person who can say Sheldon Cooper is your boyfriend, but that rings hollow if you can't lord him over others in the flesh. I forget what I bring to the party and what I take away when I leave. Please accept these valuable Cooper Coupons...

00:17:41:200000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:41:200000.Dialogue: Sheldon, she doesn't want your stupid...

00:17:43:050000.Speaker: Amy
00:17:43:050000.Dialogue: Ooh, Science Center. Redeeming. Let's go.

00:17:48:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:48:110000.Dialogue: Well played, Amy Farrah Fowler. Let me get my coat. Oh, grow up, Leonard.

00:17:55:110000.Speaker: Raj
00:17:55:110000.Dialogue: But e-excuse me, I have something to say. None of you may realize it, but I was very much looking forward to this weekend. It was gonna be like the old days-- the four of us hanging out playing video games before you guys all got girlfriends. Do you have any idea what it's like to be the only one without a girlfriend? Even if I get one someday, I'll still be the guy who got a girl after Sheldon Cooper!

00:18:27:050000.Speaker: Penny
00:18:27:050000.Dialogue: And that's how a girl makes a scene.

00:18:35:040000.Speaker: Penny
00:18:35:040000.Dialogue: I'm sorry, sweetie. You're right. You deserve your weekend. Come on, Amy, let's go.

00:18:40:200000.Speaker: Penny
00:18:40:200000.Dialogue: I'll let you hold my hair while I throw up.

00:18:58:040000.Speaker: Raj
00:18:58:040000.Dialogue: Okay, now. This is the way it's supposed to be. Men together, fighting the forces of evil.

00:19:08:140000.Speaker: Raj
00:19:08:140000.Dialogue: I can't believe this is only 64 calories.

00:19:29:010000.Scene: Some time later. The guys are asleep.
00:19:29:010000.Speaker: Mrs Wolowitz

00:19:30:180000.Scene: Some time later. The guys are asleep.
00:19:30:180000.Speaker: Mrs Wolowitz
00:19:30:180000.Dialogue: I've been worried sick for two days, and I know you turned off your phone!

00:19:37:160000.Scene: Some time later. The guys are asleep.
00:19:37:160000.Speaker: Mrs Wolowitz
00:19:37:160000.Dialogue: MRS. WOLOWITZ: You open up this door right now because I've had it up to here! I have been to the morgue and the hospital, and I spent the last half hour

00:19:44:170000.Scene: Some time later. The guys are asleep.
00:19:44:170000.Speaker: Mrs Wolowitz

00:19:51:100000.Scene: Some time later. The guys are asleep.
00:19:51:100000.Speaker: Howard
00:19:51:100000.Dialogue: That's my ride; got to go.
